questions.question_text: A technician is setting up three web servers for a retail company that takes online orders for its products. Which of the following network host services should the technician use to ensure the servers’ resources will be utilized efficiently?

discussion.content: Load balancing services ensure the server's resources will be utilized efficiently by dividing the load between the servers to ensure that all servers get distribute information equally .

Selected Answer: D
load balancers to distribute the load and ensure none of the servers are severely taxed.

Selected Answer: B
I agree with the explanation given by Phillyboy20 ..... Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is "Fuser". This is because, when the paper goes through the printer and ink is applied to it, the fuser heats up to make the ink permanent. Therefore, if the ink is smudging, it means that the fuser is not heated up enough.

questions.question_text: When a page that was printed on a laser printer is touched, the image on the paper smears. Which of the following is MOST likely the cause of this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
Just goggle "water damage dark spot phone"

comments.content: Please remove this. Aswer is D

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
LCDs have a slightly different construction. They are made from tubes that hold the crystals. That is why your LCD is never totally black. It has a mild illumination that you can see in a dark room.

These tubes can break and lose the liquid, so they can’t illuminate. That leads to dark spots that you can see even at night. And they are signs that you need to hurry up to fix the black spot on the LCD phone screen. This liquid will continue to spill and contaminate nearby pixels, and this spot will get bigger with time.

Selected Answer: D
If a smartphone has a large dark area on the screen with no visible damage indicating a cracked screen, the most likely cause is:

Liquid damage

Liquid damage can lead to various display issues, including dark spots on the screen. Even a small amount of liquid exposure can affect the phone's internal components, including the display. It can cause the liquid to seep into the layers of the screen or damage the connections, resulting in dark areas or spots on the display.

The other options:

Digitizer damage: A damaged digitizer typically affects the touch functionality of the screen and wouldn't directly cause a dark area on the display.

comments.content:

These tubes can break and lose the liquid, so they can’t illuminate. That leads to dark spots that you can see even at night. And they are signs that you need to hurry up to fix the black spot on the LCD phone screen. This liquid will continue to spill and contaminate nearby pixels, and this spot will get bigger with time. damage is most likely digitizer.

questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a smartphone that has a large dark area on the screen. The screen has no damage to indicate that it is cracked. Which of the following BEST describes why a blot is on the screen?

A user reports a repetitive clicking noise is coming from a personal laptop. A technician notes the laptop's inputs are severely delayed. Which of the following should the technician replace to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
I'm leaning toward storage device making repetitive clicking noise but then the question states severe input lag causing more confusion.

While a failing hard drive can cause various system issues, including slow performance and unexpected shutdowns, it's less likely to directly cause input delays.

Input delays are more commonly associated with issues related to the operating system, software drivers, or hardware components like the keyboard, mouse, or touchpad.

GG

Selected Answer: B
The storage device is the correct answer because it can be assumed that isn't an HDD which means it has a moving disk.
The HDD (Hard Disk Drive) is failing and the clicks are indicators of mechanical error. HDD is storage. Correct Answer is B.The storage device

C is correct. 
Trusted platform module (TPM) is a specification for hardware-based storage of digital certificates, cryptographic keys, and hashed passwords. The TPM establishes a root of trust. Each TPM microprocessor is hard coded with a unique, unchangeable key, referred to as the endorsement key.

The TPM chip has a secure storage area that a disk encryption program such as Windows BitLocker can write its keys to.
The TPM can be enabled or disabled and reset via the system setup program, though it is also possible to manage it from the OS as well.

Can not be B 
Secure boot is a UEFI feature designed to prevent a computer from being hijacked by malware. 
This question did saying anything about malware

comments.content: The question didn't say anything about malware *

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When troubleshooting the issue where BitLocker refuses to turn on due to a BIOS-level setting, the technician should FIRST check:

C. Ensure that the Trusted Platform Module is enabled.

Explanation:

BitLocker, which provides SSD-level encryption, often relies on the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) for secure key storage. If TPM is not enabled in the BIOS, BitLocker may not function correctly.

Selected Answer: C
Trusted Platform Module (TPM) is also required for BitLocker to enable SSD-level encryption on laptops. The TPM is a hardware security chip that provides cryptographic services, such as encryption and key management, to protect data on the laptop. It's C.

comments.content: Please explain why you choose Answer B?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Te correct is B

questions.question_text: A technician is preparing laptops for deployment to a medical department. The laptops require SSD-level encryption to be enabled, but BitLocker refuses to turn it on. An error message states that a BIOS-level setting has not been turned on. Which of the following should the technician check FIRST when troubleshooting this issue?

choices.D: Verify that the latest updates are installed.
choices.A: Reorder the priority in Windows Boot Manager.
choices.B: Check to make sure Secure Boot is turned on.
choices.C: Ensure that the Trusted Platform Module is enabled.
